container.heading: Data Reporting by Non-Hospital Health Care Facilities

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
Terms Defined.
“Commission” means the Maryland Health Care Commission.
“Non-hospital health care facility” means:
A related institution, as defined in Health-General Article, §19-301, Annotated Code of Maryland;
An ambulatory surgical facility, as defined in Health-General Article, §19-114, Annotated Code of Maryland;
A facility providing intermediate care, as that term is defined in COMAR 10.24.01.01;
A home health agency, as defined in Health-General Article, §19-401, Annotated Code of Maryland;
A hospice, as defined in Health-General Article, §19-901, Annotated Code of Maryland;
A freestanding medical facility, as defined in Health-General Article, §19-3A-01, Annotated Code of Maryland;
A comprehensive care facility, as defined in COMAR 10.24.01.01; and
Other non-hospital health institutions, services, or programs that may be specified as requiring a certificate of need under State law.
A non-hospital health care facility shall submit accurate, timely, and complete data which the Commission considers to be necessary for planning and analysis purposes, as requested by the Commission.
The information requested by the Commission may include, but is not limited to, the following types of information:
Aggregate facility data as follows:
Service configuration;
Location;
Operational characteristics; and
Utilization; and
Patient-level data as follows:
Demographic characteristics;
Admission, discharge, and disposition data;
Diagnosis and treatment data; and
Payment source and charges.
The Commission shall provide notice of the form, format, and schedule for data reporting by non-hospital health care facilities.
Failure to report the data required under this regulation may subject a non-hospital health care facility to penalties under COMAR 10.25.12.
The requirements of this chapter are in addition to any other obligation to report information to the Commission by law or as a condition on a certificate of need or other Commission approval.
Extension.
A non-hospital health care facility, by letter to the Executive Director of the Commission, may request an extension of its data submission date.
The Executive Director of the Commission, for good cause shown, may grant an extension of a data submission date.
Subject to §B of this regulation, summary studies, reports, or other compilations developed by the Commission from the data submitted in accordance with this chapter are public information.
Disclosure under §A of this regulation may not be made in such a way that the data furnished for a specific patient can be identified.
